Chris Gallo


Charlotte, NC | hotdogsandeggs.com


Senior Customer Support Pro

It's my job to make customers feel important. Three principles that help me do that:

  1. Listen to what people do, and not just what they say.
  2. Ask questions because the best answer is often a question.
  3. Suggest workarounds. Every one is better when they're resourceful.

EXPERIENCE

Highrise: highrisehq.com

Head of customer support since September 30, 2014. I was part of the small 5-person team tasked with bringing the 37Signals product back to life. I've worked remotely my entire time here. The biggest lesson I've learned working with Highrise is to how to be resourceful.

In my time here, I've . . .

  • Answered between 75-100 customer support requests per day.
  • Wrote and helped build a new help center, the product's official documentation, to help customers learn to use Highrise
  • Learned how to perform API requests, and share examples with customers.
  • Made countless copy suggestions/pull requests to improve the customer's experience using the app.
  • Put together the Extras page (integrations) on the marketing site, and wrote the copy for a few feature pages.
  • Hosted classes, phone calls, and created videos to assist in helping people get started using Highrise.

Spring Metrics (now Spring Engage): springengage.com

Customer support specialist, 2013-2014, while living in Raleigh, NC. This is where I cut my teeth learning the ins and outs of supporting customers that use a software product.

  • Supported hundreds of eCommerce businesses that use behavioral targeting software.
  • Helped folks get started by inserting a JavaScript snippet on their ecommerce stores.
  • Wrote tutorials, blog posts, and technical guides to assist current and future clients.

Four Clouds (Four Dispatch): fourdispatch.com

Marketing & Sales Coordinator, 2012–2013, while living in Chapel Hill, NC. This was my first job working in software for a specific product.

  • Helped launch Four Dispatch, a mobile and web app for the delivery/service industry.
  • Completed over 100 customer development interviews.
  • Put together a blog that allowed us to understand potential customers.

UNC-Chapel Hill Athletic Communications: goheels.com

Communications Assistant, 2009–2011. My first job out of college working for my alma mater.

  • Media contact for baseball, softball, women’s basketball, and women’s volleyball.
  • Served as statistician and wrote official game/match press releases to promote media exposure.
